Builder¶

class ServerBuilder(object=null)¶

Object = server JSON data, leave blank if you dont have and object and just want to use ServerBuilder

Arguments

  • object (Object) –

ServerBuilder.createServer(applicationInstance)¶

Creates the server directly from this class using your NodeactylApplication instance Make sure to login to the Application before passing it through this function!

Arguments

  • applicationInstance (Object) – Your NodeactylApplication instance

Returns

Promise –

ServerBuilder.getServerObject()¶

Returns the servers JSON object

Returns

ServerBuilder.setJson(json)¶

Sets the entire Server JSON object

Arguments

  • json (JSON) –

ServerBuilder.setServerAdditionalAllocations(allocations)¶

Allows you to add multiple allocations to this serer

By default this is an empty array []

Arguments

  • allocations (Array) –

ServerBuilder.setServerAllocationJson(json)¶

If you want allocations set at once, insert your json data here

Arguments

  • json (JSON) –

ServerBuilder.setServerAllocationLimit(allocationLimit)¶

Sets the allocation limit of this server

Arguments

  • allocationLimit (Integer) –

ServerBuilder.setServerBackupLimit(backupLimit)¶

Sets the max amount of backups this server is allowed to have

Arguments

  • backupLimit (Integer) –

ServerBuilder.setServerCPU(cpu)¶

Sets the max amount of CPU usage for this server, 100 = 1 core 200 = 2 cores etc etc

Arguments

  • cpu (Integer) –

ServerBuilder.setServerDatabaseLimit(databaseLimit)¶

Sets the amount of databases this server is allowed to have

Arguments

  • databaseLimit (Integer) –

ServerBuilder.setServerDefaultAllocation(allocationId)¶

Sets the default servers allocation

By default this is 1

Arguments

  • allocationId (Integer) –

ServerBuilder.setServerDeployJson(json)¶

If you want to set server deploy data at once, insert json object here

Arguments

  • json (JSON) –

ServerBuilder.setServerDeployLocations(locations)¶

Sets the locations of where to deploy this to

MUST BE AN ARRAY By default this is set to [1]

Arguments

  • locations (Array) –

ServerBuilder.setServerDockerImage(dockerImage)¶

Sets the servers docker image to use

By default this is set to Java

Arguments

  • dockerImage (String) –

ServerBuilder.setServerEgg(eggId)¶

Sets the servers egg to use

By default this is 1

Arguments

  • eggId (Integer) –

ServerBuilder.setServerEnvironmentJson(json)¶

If want all env variables set at once, insert a JSON object here

Arguments

  • json (JSON) –

ServerBuilder.setServerEnvironmentVersion(version)¶

Sets the environment version number, do note this doesnt work with all eggs, if you want and egg added it must be public and on github (or any git provider)!

By default these are all set to “LATEST”

Arguments

  • version (String) –

ServerBuilder.setServerFeatureLimitsJson(json)¶

If you want to set all feature limits at one time, insert a JSON object here

Arguments

  • json (JSON) –

ServerBuilder.setServerIO(io)¶

Sets the IO for this server to use in MB (Prolly shouldnt change this)

Arguments

  • io (Integer) –

ServerBuilder.setServerLimitsJson(json)¶

If you want to set all server limits at one time, you can make a JSON object and insert it here

Arguments

  • json (JSON) –

ServerBuilder.setServerName(serverName)¶

Sets the servers name

Arguments

  • serverName (String) –

ServerBuilder.setServerNodeJSStartupCommand(command)¶

If your using a NodeJS egg, set the startup command here otherwise dont use this

Arguments

  • command (String) –

ServerBuilder.setServerOOMDisabled(isDisabled)¶

Sets wether or not you want OOM disabled

By default this value is set as true

Arguments

  • isDisabled (Boolean) –

ServerBuilder.setServerOwner(ownerId)¶

Sets the owners ID

Arguments

  • ownerId (Integer) –

ServerBuilder.setServerPortRange(portRange)¶

Sets a range of ports that this server can use

By default this value is empty []

Arguments

  • portRange (Array) –

ServerBuilder.setServerRAM(ram)¶

Max amount of RAM this server can have in MB

Arguments

  • ram (Integer) –

ServerBuilder.setServerSkipScripts(yesOrNo)¶

Sets wether or not this server should skip scripts

By default this value is set as false

Arguments

  • yesOrNo (Boolean) –

ServerBuilder.setServerStartsWhenCompleted(yesOrNo)¶

Sets wether or not you want this server to start when it has finished creating

By default this is set at true

Arguments

  • yesOrNo (Boolean) –

ServerBuilder.setServerStartup(startupCmd)¶

Sets the servers startup comand to use

By default this is set to “java -Xms128M -Xmx128M -jar server.jar”

Arguments

  • startupCmd (String) –

ServerBuilder.setServerSwap(swap)¶

Max amount of swam this server can have in MB

Arguments

  • swap (Integer) –

ServerBuilder.setServerUsesDedicatedIp(yesOrNo)¶

Sets wether or not this server should get its own dedicated IP

By default this is false

Arguments

  • yesOrNo (Boolean) –
